2303830.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2303830
In-book reference  : Book 21, Hadith 001
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 21, Hadith 001
2303830.text: Umm Kulthum, the daughter of 'Uqba ibn Abi Mu'ayt, reported that she heard the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, say, "Someone who makes peace between people by saying something good or relates something good is not a liar."

2303840.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2303840
In-book reference  : Book 21, Hadith 002
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 21, Hadith 002
2303840.text: 'Abdullah reported that the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said, "You must be truthful. Truthfulness leads to dutifulness and dutifulness leads to the Garden. A man continues to tell the truth until he is written as a siddiq with Allah. Beware of lying. Lying leads to deviance and deviance leads to the Fire. A man continues to lie until he is written as a liar with Allah."

2303850.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2303850
In-book reference  : Book 21, Hadith 003
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 21, Hadith 003
2303850.text: 'Abdullah said, "Lying is not correct, neither in seriousness nor in jest. None of you should promise his child something and then not give it to him."

2303860.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2303860
In-book reference  : Book 21, Hadith 004
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 21, Hadith 004
2303860.text: Ibn 'Umar reported that the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said, "The believer who mixes with people and endures their injury is better than the person who does not mix with people nor endure their injury."

2303870.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2303870
In-book reference  : Book 21, Hadith 005
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 21, Hadith 005
2303870.text: Abu Musa reported that the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said, "No one - nothing - is more patient in enduring an injury which he hears than Allah Almighty. They claim that He has a son, and yet He still cures them and provides for them."

2303880.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2303880
In-book reference  : Book 21, Hadith 006
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 21, Hadith 006
2303880.text: 'Abdullah said, "The Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, swore an oath like one of the oaths that people swear and a man of the Ansar said, 'By Allah, it is not an oath by which the Face of Allah Almighty is desired." I said, 'I will tell the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace. I went to him while he was with his Companions and I spoke to him in confidence. It clearly affected him greatly, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, and his face changed colour so that I wished that I had not told him. Then he said, 'Musa was injured with greater than that and he endured it.'"

2303890.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2303890
In-book reference  : Book 21, Hadith 007
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 21, Hadith 007
2303890.text: Abu'd-Darda' reported that the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said, "Shall I tell you a degree better than prayer, fasting and sadaqa?" "Yes," they replied. He went to say, Improving a state of friendship. Causing discord in a state of friendship is what shaves things away."

2303900.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2303900
In-book reference  : Book 21, Hadith 008
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 21, Hadith 008
2303900.text: "Fear Allah and put things right between you," (8:1), Ibn 'Abbas said, "This is an injunction from Allah to the believers to fear Allah and to put things right between them."

2303910.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2303910
In-book reference  : Book 21, Hadith 009
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 21, Hadith 009
2303910.text: Sufyan ibn Usayd al-Hadrami reported that he heard the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, say, "It is great treachery to tell something to your brother so that he believes you when you are lying to him."

2303920.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2303920
In-book reference  : Book 21, Hadith 010
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 21, Hadith 010
2303920.text: Ibn 'Abbas reported that the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said, "Do not dispute with your brother. Do not make fun of him. Do not make a promise to him and then break it."

2303930.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2303930
In-book reference  : Book 21, Hadith 011
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 21, Hadith 011
2303930.text: wailing and attacking a person's lineage."

2303940.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2303940
In-book reference  : Book 21, Hadith 012
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 21, Hadith 012
2303940.text: A woman called Fusayla said that she heard her father say, "I asked, 'Messenger of Allah, is it part of disobedience for a man to help his people in something which is unjust?' 'Yes,' he replied."
